isis.stitle: RECONDITIONING ROTORS - INSPECTION - BRAKE PAD TRANSFER

svcproc.title: BRAKE PAD TRANSFER
svcproc.para:
Brake pad transfer is indicated by a thin layer of brake pad material which has become welded to the rotor braking surfaces ( Figure 23
). Initially the brake pad deposit will be spotty. The spots will continue to develop until they cover the rotor's circumference. As the spots form, they will accelerate brake pad wear. The brake pad deposit may be removed by resurfacing the rotor.

figure.caption: Figure 23. Rotor Showing Brake Pad Transfer

svcproc.para: Brake pad transfer is a result of extremely high operating temperatures, which may be caused by continued hard stops, brake system imbalances or system malfunction.
